dt: {bc}the action of calling something to the attention of the public especially by paid announcements
{bc}the business of preparing {d_link|advertisements|advertisement} for publication or broadcast

shortdef: the action of calling something to the attention of the public especially by paid announcements
the business of preparing advertisements for publication or broadcast

dt: {bc}to announce publicly especially by a printed notice or a broadcast
{bc}to call public attention to especially by emphasizing desirable qualities so as to arouse a desire to buy or patronize {bc}{sx|promote||}

et: Middle English {it}advertisen, avertysen{/it} "to pay attention to, take note of, notify, inform," borrowed from Anglo-French {it}avertiss-, advertiss-,{/it} stem of {it}avertir, advertir{/it} "to notify, (reflexive) recognize, be mindful of" {ma}{mat|advert:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make something known to : notify
to make publicly and generally known
to announce publicly especially by a printed notice or a broadcast

dt: {bc}an agency that handles advertising for clients

dt.t: She works for an {it}advertising agency{/it} in New York.

shortdef: an agency that handles advertising for clients

dt: {bc}{d_link|advertising|advertising} that responds to or rebuts the claims of other advertising

dt.t: Previous public health and policy approaches to affect smoking prevalence have included … {wi}counter-advertising{/wi} campaigns …

If Apple had not made the purchase, its rivals would have swung in with some disruptive {wi}counter-advertising{/wi} and taken the full concentration of the spotlight away from the new MacBook and the Apple Watch.

shortdef: advertising that responds to or rebuts the claims of other advertising
